H0.text: Through much of 2009 former shareholders of what UK bank sought compensation from the UK government. Royal Bank of Scotland

H1.text: Through much of 2009 former shareholders of what UK bank sought compensation from the UK government. Lloyds Banking Group

H2.text: Through much of 2009 former shareholders of what UK bank sought compensation from the UK government. Bradford & Bingley

H3.text: Through much of 2009 former shareholders of what UK bank sought compensation from the UK government. Northern rock

A4.text: Over 300 shareholders complained to the UK Shareholders Association that they had not received information relating to the fate of their holdings.

A5.text: Peter Clokey of PricewaterhouseCoopers was appointed by the government in June 2009 to act as independent valuer of the business, and it was reported that shareholders would be told how much compensation they were entitled to by June 2010.
